org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model

Class AbstractSelectable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model.EmbeddedObject
      • org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model.AbstractSelectable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOperable, ISelectable, Supportable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHierarchicalSelectable, AbstractListSelectable

    public abstract class AbstractSelectable
extends EmbeddedObject
implements ISelectable
    History:
      Apr 25, 2014    (Lei Wang) Initial release.
  May 29, 2014    (Lei Wang) Use single-click for selectItem, double-click for activateItem.
  Oct 15, 2014    (Lei Wang) Modify showOnPage(): move the code 'test visiblility' to super class.
  Nov 05, 2014    (Lei Wang) Add waitAndVerifyItemSelected(): used to verify item selection.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion, boolean verify, org.openqa.selenium.Keys key, java.awt.Point offset)
      Try to activate (double-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'.
      void clearCache()
      clear the cache 'contentObjects'.
      protected void clickElement(Element element, org.openqa.selenium.Keys key, java.awt.Point offset, int mouseButtonNumber, int numberOfClick)
      Try to get the Selenium WebElement object from parameter 'element', then click that WebElement object.
      After calling this method, the parent of Element may become stale.
      protected Element[] getCacheableContent()
      Get the real-time content from WebElement.
      For some components like Tree, Menu etc.
      Element[] getContent()
      Try to get the cached content according to the WebElement.
      If no cached content can be found, then get the real-time content by calling getCacheableContent(),
      and put the content in the cache and return it.
      If subclass doesn't need this functionality, then just override this method.
      If subclass needs this functionality, then override method getCacheableContent()
      void selectItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion, boolean verify, org.openqa.selenium.Keys key, java.awt.Point offset, int mouseButtonNumber)
      Try to select (single-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'.
      protected void showOnPage(Element element)
      Make the element is in the container, and visible on the page.
      For example, some element may not be visible if there are too many elements in its container;
      User can scroll to make the element visible on the page.
      User may need to wait for a while so that the element related object can be updated (like position-onscreen, visibility etc.)

      This method gives a default implementation:
      it will scroll and align the top of element to the top of container.
      Before this method is called, it is suggested to call EmbeddedObject.isShowOnPage(Element) firstly.
      void verifyContains(TextMatchingCriterion criterion)
      Verify the item (specified by text, partialMatch and matchIndex) is contained.
      protected void verifyItemSelected(Element element)
      Note:In subclass, we need to update the 'selected' property of Element.
      Please call waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element) instead to verify selection,
      as the first method will also try the wait for element to be ready and call EmbeddedObject.refresh(boolean).
      protected void verifyItemSelection(Element element, boolean expectSelected) 
      void verifyItemSelection(TextMatchingCriterion criterion, boolean expectSelected)
      Verify the item (specified by text, partialMatch and matchIndex) is selected or un-selected.
      protected void waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element element)
      Wait Item ready, and verify the item has been selected.
      Before verification, we need to refresh the parent if the page doesn't change.
      protected void waitElementReady(Element element)
      Wait for element ready, means that element's attribute has been updated.
      This method just wait 200 milliseconds, subclass may give a more detail implementation.
      protected void waitElementReady(Element element, int milliseconds)
      Wait for element ready, means that element's attribute has been updated.
      This method just wait some time, subclass may give a more detail implementation.
      When this method will be called?
      For example, before calling verifyItemSelected(Element), because
      verifyItemSelected(Element) needs to check element's attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        public Element[] getContent()
                     throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to get the cached content according to the WebElement.
        If no cached content can be found, then get the real-time content by calling getCacheableContent(),
        and put the content in the cache and return it.
        If subclass doesn't need this functionality, then just override this method.
        If subclass needs this functionality, then override method getCacheableContent()
        Specified by:
        getContent in interface ISelectable
        Returns:
        Element[] an array of the element
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        getCacheableContent()

      • getCacheableContent

        protected Element[] getCacheableContent()
                                 throws SeleniumPlusException
        Get the real-time content from WebElement.
        For some components like Tree, Menu etc. it is time-consuming to retrieve content,
        user may implement this method instead of getContent() so that the retrived content
        will be kept in cache, and getContent() will use the content in the cache.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        getContent()

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        clear the cache 'contentObjects'.
        Specified by:
        clearCache in interface IOperable

      • selectItem

        public void selectItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
              boolean verify,
              org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
              java.awt.Point offset,
              int mouseButtonNumber)
                throws SeleniumPlusException
        Description copied from interface: ISelectable
        Try to select (single-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time. If the parameter offset is provided, then click at offset relative to the top-left corner of view; otherwise at the center. The parameter mouseButtonNumber decides right-click or left-click.
        Note: There are maybe some callback methods associated with the item-container, but setting select text MAY NOT invoke them, in the implementation of this method we should make sure those callbacks are invoked (we can fire some events.)
        Specified by:
        selectItem in interface ISelectable
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        mouseButtonNumber - int, the mouse-button-number representing right, middle, or left button.
        it can be WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_RIGHT
        or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • activateItem

        public void activateItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
                boolean verify,
                org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
                java.awt.Point offset)
                  throws SeleniumPlusException
        Description copied from interface: ISelectable
        Try to activate (double-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time.
        Specified by:
        activateItem in interface ISelectable
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • verifyItemSelection

        public void verifyItemSelection(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
                       boolean expectSelected)
                         throws SeleniumPlusException
        Description copied from interface: ISelectable
        Verify the item (specified by text, partialMatch and matchIndex) is selected or un-selected.
        Specified by:
        verifyItemSelection in interface ISelectable
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        expectSelected - boolean, true if the item is expected 'selected'; false if expected 'unselected'.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the verification fails.

      • verifyItemSelection

        protected void verifyItemSelection(Element element,
                       boolean expectSelected)
                            throws SeleniumPlusException
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element to check.
        expectSelected - boolean, true if the element is expected 'selected'; false if expected 'unselected'.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the verification fails.

      • clickElement

        protected void clickElement(Element element,
                org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
                java.awt.Point offset,
                int mouseButtonNumber,
                int numberOfClick)
                     throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to get the Selenium WebElement object from parameter 'element', then click that WebElement object.
        After calling this method, the parent of Element may become stale. We may need to call EmbeddedObject.refresh(boolean).
        Atter calling this method, user may need to verify that element has been selected. Please call waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element)
        instead of verifyItemSelected(Element), as the first method will also try the wait for element
        to be ready and call EmbeddedObject.refresh(boolean).
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element to select
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null.
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        mouseButtonNumber - int, the mouse-button-number representing right, middle, or left button. it can be WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_RIGHT
        or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE.
        numberOfClick - int, 1 means single-click, 2 means double-click
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        #refresh(boolean)}, waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element)

      • showOnPage

        protected void showOnPage(Element element)
                   throws SeleniumPlusException
        Make the element is in the container, and visible on the page.
        For example, some element may not be visible if there are too many elements in its container;
        User can scroll to make the element visible on the page.
        User may need to wait for a while so that the element related object can be updated (like position-onscreen, visibility etc.)

        This method gives a default implementation:
        it will scroll and align the top of element to the top of container.
        Before this method is called, it is suggested to call EmbeddedObject.isShowOnPage(Element) firstly.
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element needs to be visible on page
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        #isShowOnPage(Element)}

      • waitElementReady

        protected void waitElementReady(Element element,
                    int milliseconds)
                         throws SeleniumPlusException
        Wait for element ready, means that element's attribute has been updated.
        This method just wait some time, subclass may give a more detail implementation.
        When this method will be called?
        For example, before calling verifyItemSelected(Element), because
        verifyItemSelected(Element) needs to check element's attributes.
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element needs to be ready
        milliseconds - int, the time to wait
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        #verifyItemSelected(Element)}

      • waitElementReady

        protected void waitElementReady(Element element)
                         throws SeleniumPlusException
        Wait for element ready, means that element's attribute has been updated.
        This method just wait 200 milliseconds, subclass may give a more detail implementation.
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element needs to be ready
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • waitAndVerifyItemSelected

        protected void waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element element)
                                  throws SeleniumPlusException
        Wait Item ready, and verify the item has been selected.
        Before verification, we need to refresh the parent if the page doesn't change.
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element has been selected or clicked or double-clicked.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        #verifyItemSelected(Element)}

      • verifyItemSelected

        protected void verifyItemSelected(Element element)
                           throws SeleniumPlusException
        Note:In subclass, we need to update the 'selected' property of Element.
        Please call waitAndVerifyItemSelected(Element) instead to verify selection,
        as the first method will also try the wait for element to be ready and call EmbeddedObject.refresh(boolean).
        Parameters:
        element - Element, the element to verify that it is selected.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
